summary: Internal Deutsche Bank emails discussing Know Your Customer (KYC) due diligence regarding Jeffrey Epstein in light of recent press coverage, and a separate email thread regarding a Global Master Repurchase Agreement (GMRA) with Southern Financial LLC. The KYC discussion references press allegations involving Prince Andrew and Alan Dershowitz.

persons.context: Receives request to ensure an updated KYC is completed regarding Jeffrey Epstein due to recent press.

persons.role: Credit Risk Management at Deutsche Asset & Wealth Management

connections.description: Williams requests Morris to ensure an updated KYC is completed regarding Jeffrey Epstein.
Sabba forwards a legal matter (GMRA) to Maxey and instructs her to liaise with Richard Kahn.
Maxey is communicating regarding a GMRA with Southern Financial LLC, addressed to 'Harry and Jeffrey', the latter likely being Epstein.
Both are named together in a Wall Street Journal article link regarding denied sex-scandal claims connected to Jeffrey Epstein.
Epstein is the central figure in press stories that also involve allegations about Prince Andrew.
Epstein is the central figure in press stories that also involve allegations about his former lawyer, Alan Dershowitz.

events.title: Deutsche Bank KYC Review Triggered
events.description: Troy Williams emails Paul Morris requesting an updated Know Your Customer review for Jeffrey Epstein due to recent press coverage.

events.title: GMRA Draft Sent to Southern Financial
events.description: Renee Maxey sends a draft Global Master Repurchase Agreement between Deutsche Bank AG and Southern Financial LLC to 'Harry and Jeffrey' for review and execution.

events.title: Press Coverage of Epstein Allegations
events.description: Recent press articles, including one from the Wall Street Journal, report on sex-scandal claims involving Jeffrey Epstein, Prince Andrew, and Alan Dershowitz, who deny the allegations.

locations: New York, NY (60 Wall Street, Deutsche Bank AG office)
Jacksonville, Florida (5022 Gate Parkway, DB Services New Jersey, Inc. office)
keyFacts: Deutsche Bank staff internally discussed conducting an updated Know Your Customer (KYC) review for Jeffrey Epstein in January 2015 due to recent negative press.
The press coverage triggering the review included a Wall Street Journal article about sex-scandal claims involving Epstein, Prince Andrew, and lawyer Alan Dershowitz.
In a separate thread, Deutsche Bank Legal was finalizing a Global Master Repurchase Agreement (GMRA) with Southern Financial LLC, addressed to 'Harry and Jeffrey' (likely Jeffrey Epstein).
The document shows financial institutions were actively monitoring and managing their relationship with Epstein in response to public allegations.
The email correspondence is marked 'Confidential - Pursuant to Fed. R. Crim. P. 6(e)', indicating it was part of or related to grand jury proceedings.
